instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message: I have water damage <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and i fan spins 5 seconds and stops i went thru the rails and the 5v and 3.3v in s3 state are going from 0v to their normal voltage and back to 0. On <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> i have VIN and all enable signals and i think is the actual chip. Any ideas ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message: CPU vcore goes from 0 to 1v and back to 0

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message:
This could be anything, where was the liquid damage?
Does the fan start and stop and then start again in a loop?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message: liquid damage around <TRANSISTOR>Q2730</TRANSISTOR> and i replaced <CAPACITOR>C2231</CAPACITOR> because was hanging not soldered from the water. And yes fan goes in loop start stop start stop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message: Can be anything. Inspect for corrosion again. Possible under SMC/PCH

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Fan spins 5 seconds and stop
threads.message: i clean it in ultrasonic cleaner ill try to measure around and see
